Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Earring
Description: This earring is circular-shaped with a triangular cross section. The edge has a sharp ridge and it is not decorated. The ring has been cut over a width of 0,2 cm. The exterior diametre of the earring is 1,8 cm, the interior diametre is 1 cm and the maximum thickness is 0,6 cm. This is a simplified version of numerous carnelian earrings found in tombs dating to the New Kingdom in this area.
